text: A woman in Mexico 's Oaxaca state , who is later crucial to piecing together the epidemic , becomes ill .
The World Health Organization notifies Mexico of strange flu cases occurring in California .
The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention organizes a teleconference with Mexico and a WHO team to discuss the situations in California and Oaxaca .
The CDC announces it has identified a new type of swine flu in two U.S. children in California .
A Canadian laboratory identifies the new virus in Mexico , which is appearing outside of Oaxaca .  Mexico closes schools in Mexico City and surrounding area because of the flu .

The CDC says Mexican patients had the same new H1N1 virus as was found in United States .  The WHO says it activated its command center for acute public health events .  Mexico confirms its first deaths from the new virus .
Mexican President Felipe Calderon issues an emergency decree giving the government special powers to run tests on sick people and order them to be isolated .
The US declares a public health emergency .  Canada confirms its first cases of swine flu .

A 22-month-old Mexican boy infected with swine flu dies while visiting Texas , though the strain of his flu is not confirmed for two more days .  The U.S. State Department advises against nonessential travel to Mexico .  WHO raises its pandemic alert to phase 4 , indicating a significantly increased risk of a global outbreak of a serious new disease .  Spain confirms first case of swine flu in Europe .
Israel , New Zealand confirm cases of swine flu
WHO raises its pandemic alert to phase 5 , meaning the world is at imminent risk of a pandemic .  Mexico 's Calderon orders partial economic shutdown starting on May 1 .
The U.S. CDC says the flu outbreak may not be as severe as it first seemed .
Mexico says business operations will return to normal on May 6 .
